showScoreExcerpt:
Matthew Spangler’s stage adaptation is faithful to a fault – two faults, really. The story hasn’t been sufficiently rethought as a work of theater: Amir Arison performs not just as Amir the adult and Amir the child, but also as Amir the (wordy, stilted) narrator… Spangler also faithfully renders aspects of Hosseini’s novel that I had some qualms about when I read it long ago, [now become] full-blown objections.
